choices.D: Implement a new database availability group (DAG) that contains the server in the Brussels office and a new Exchange Server 2019 server in the main office, and then create a mailbox database copy on the new server in the main office.
choices.A: In the main office, deploy an Exchange Server 2016 server that has the Unified Messaging role installed, and then move the mailboxes from the Brussels office to the new server.
choices.B: Deploy a Microsoft Skype for Business 2019 server to the main office, and then move the mailboxes from the Brussels office to an Exchange Server 2019 server in the main office.
choices.C: Implement a new mailbox database on an Exchange Server 2019 server in the main office, and then move the mailboxes from the Brussels office to the new mailbox database.

discussion.content:
Requirement is 'Ensure that all the former Brussels office users always maintain access to hosted voicemail.'

Migrating them to 2019 in main office will UM-disable them. New 2016 server in main office is probably most straightforward solution.

https://practical365.com/exchange-server/goodbye-unified-messaging-what-now/

comments.content:
I think it's B (Deploy a Microsoft Skype for Business 2019 server to the main office, and then move the mailboxes from the Brussels office to an Exchange Server 2019 server in the main office.)
The reason is that a lower version of Exchange cannot be installed ones you install a higher version.

agree. from the planned change: Close the Brussels office and move all the users in the Brussels office to the main office. All the mailboxes in the Brussels office will be moved to a server in the main office. 
so no more Exchange 2016 there. only the 2019 in the main office.
Sfb does not provide VoiceMail functionality. It should be A. Deploy Exch 2016 in main office and then move mailboxes.

I agree. Partial feature set of UM services provided by EX2016 are available via 'Cloud Hosted Voicemail'. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/hybrid/plan-cloud-voicemail . SfB 2019 server is a requirement though.
Since the goal is to maintain 'hosted voicemail' functionality and move all of the mailboxes from EX2016 to the server in the main office, 'B' seems to be the right answer. Even it may seem like the least preffereed solution...

discussion.content: A is the Answer - B Cannot be the answer as UM is Deprecated with Exchange 2019 - Exchange 2016 server is required to host UM Functionality
It has to be B. If you also consider that answer C is included in answer B, how can B be incorrect?
The answer is B. Deploy SfB on prem to facilitate Cloud Voicemail. Trust me.

questions.question_text:
You need to recommend a procedure for closing the Brussels office that meets the technical requirements.
What should you recommend?

HOTSPOT -
You need to implement a solution to meet the technical requirements for the SCL.
How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:

comments.content:
The requirements state that if an email message has a spam confidence level (SCL) of 3 or higher should be moved to Junk folder.
So the SCLJunkThreshold should be 2.

The SCL value that's used when the junk email rule is enabled in the mailbox, and an SCL Junk Email folder threshold isn't configured on the mailbox.
A message with an SCL value that's greater than this value is moved to the Junk Email folder by the junk email rule.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure the required objects for the branch office administrators.
What should you create for each administrator?

choices.B: a management role scope and a management role assignment
choices.D: a management role and a management role assignment policy
choices.C: a management role scope and a management role group
choices.A: a management role assignment policy and a management role group

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to implement a solution that meets the technical requirements for the retention of junk email, sent items, and deleted items.
What is the minimum number of retention policies and retention tags you should use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
3, 1
Junk: delete after 14 days
Sent & deleted: delete after 30 days
A RPT can only apply to a single default folder at one time and hence there must be 3 retention tags.
A mailbox can only have a single retention policy at a time
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/security-and-compliance/messaging-records-management/retention-tags-and-policies#messaging-records-management-strategy
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/security-and-compliance/messaging-records-management/retention-tags-and-policies#retention-policies
